content: Korean BBQ typically involves grilling marinated meat, often beef or pork, on a tabletop grill. The meat is often accompanied by a variety of side dishes such as vegetables, sauces, and rice. Japanese Yakitori, on the other hand, is a type of grilled chicken skewer often served as a snack or appetizer. The chicken is usually seasoned with salt or a sweet/savory sauce and grilled over charcoal. While both cuisines involve grilling meat, Korean BBQ tends to be more of a sit-down meal with a variety of dishes served, while Yakitori is typically eaten on the go or as a small plate.
